description:
Raw and Qcow2 image type support preallocate image.
by enable this we need to set preallocate_images in config file.
currently , we can set it to any character except 'none' to enable it.
title: preallocate_images can be arbitrary characters to enable preallocate feature

comments.content:
Raw and Qcow2 image type support preallocate image.
by enable this we need to set preallocate_images in config file.
currently , we can set it to any character except 'none' to enable it.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~taget-9

comments.content:
Reviewed:  https://review.openstack.org/160105
Committed: https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/nova/commit/?id=41bc820e14e0f50af627ae52fa0a8abbe134d5a5
Submitter: Jenkins
Branch:    master

commit 41bc820e14e0f50af627ae52fa0a8abbe134d5a5
Author: Eli Qiao <email address hidden>
Date:   Sat Feb 28 17:13:00 2015 +0800

    Libvirt: preallocate_images CONFIG can be arbitrary characters
    
    We can now set preallocate_images as any characters as long as it is
    not equal to 'none' to enable preallocate images function, this is
    too bad.
    
    This patch changes the condition to equal to 'space'/'Space'/'SPACE'
    
    Closes-Bug: 1427092
    Change-Id: Ie8f4861fb77d2c3c3a8976fb7768ced12e7d8d5b
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack
